intro: Arabis juncea, commonly known as wallflower, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, four-petaled flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Arabis juncea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. It is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of oilseed.
